item.title: Sara add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Sara add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Sara add a quote by Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy
item.description: "We are the music makers, and we are the dreamers of dreams." -- Arthur William Edgar O'Shaughnessy

item.title: Sara add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "If I knew that today would be the last time I’d see you, I would hug you tight and pray the Lord be the keeper of your soul. If I knew that this would be the last time you pass through this door, I’d embrace you, kiss you, and call you back for one more. If I knew that this would be the last time I would hear your voice, I’d take hold of each word to be able to hear it over and over again. If I knew this is the last time I see you, I’d tell you I love you, and would not just assume foolishly you know it already." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Sara add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sara add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sara add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "What lies behind us and what lies ahead of us are tiny matters compared to what lives within us." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Sara add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Sara add a quote by Natalie Goldberg
item.description: "Anything you do fully is an alone journey." -- Natalie Goldberg

item.title: Sara add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "In eternity there is no time, only an instant long enough for a joke." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Sara add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sara add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sara add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Stuff your eyes with wonder, he said, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Sara add a quote by Richard Bach
item.description: "Argue for your limitations and, sure enough, they're yours." -- Richard Bach

item.title: Sara add a quote by Richard Leigh
item.description: "You’ve got to sing like you don’t need the money, Love like you’ll never get hurt. You’ve got to dance like nobody’s watchin’." -- Richard Leigh

item.title: Sara add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: Sara add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Sara add a quote by Edward Abbey
item.description: "The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time." -- Edward Abbey

item.title: Sara add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth." -- Pablo Picasso

item.title: Sara add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Sara add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "When I do good, I feel good. When I do bad, I feel bad. That's my religion." -- Abraham Lincoln
